result.execSummary:
The defendant Mary J. Fisher was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Bail Jumping-Felony, a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 946.49(1)(b).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Concurrent with: Jackson County Case No. 15CF135 and 16CF124.

superMiscConds.notes: Outstanding financial obligations shall be collected pursuant to statutory provisions, including deductions from inmate prison monies.  If reconfined or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and government entities for outstanding financial obligations.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt.
Seek and maintain full time employment in an occupation approved by her agent.  Not to terminate her employment without her agent's prior approval.

If agent recommends, defendant must attend and successfully complete an alcohol assessment and comply with any recommended treatment.  Defendant is to execute any releases necessary for agent to verify compliance.

Defendant to be subject to random testing by his agent.

If agent recommends, defendant must attend and successfully complete a drug assessment, and comply with any recommended treatment.  Defendant to execute any releases necessary for agent to verify compliance.

Defendant to be subject to random testing by his agent.

Not to enter into any bars, taverns, liquor stores, liquor department of grocery stores, the bar areas of restaurants. Defendant may not possess or consume any alcohol, nor be anywhere alcohol is available for consumption on the premises where the defendant is located.

  Not to possess or consume any controlled substances.   Not to possess any drug paraphernalia.  Not to possess any prescription medications of any kind unless those have been prescribed to the defendant by a physician, and in that case, the defendant shall take such medications only as prescribed.  Defendant shall not alter the form of any prescription prior to, or in conjunction with, ingestion.  Not to associate with any known illegal drug users or dealers, or their residences.

The defendant shall comply with any treatment, evaluations and/or programming as deemed appropriate by a risk and needs assessment and the agent.  Defendant must sign any releases agent deems necessary to verify defendant's compliance with extended supervision conditions.

Obey all no contact orders made by her agent.  

Court advised defendant of the DNA submission requirement.

supervisions.notes: Concurrent with: same as prison sentence.

records.addlTxt: DNA submission form
1.  Days of credit from the Jackson County Sheriff's Dept.

ADA Melissa Inlow appeared for the State.  Defendant appeared in person and with Attorney Kisken.  Parties have the PSI. No correction noted by the parties.  Court noted the 10CM270 offense, was a county ordinance and a forfeiture.  State recommending a total of 8 years bifurcated as 3 years initial confinement and 5 years extended supervision in 15CF135.  Pay restitution to the law firm.  AODA and recommended treatment.  Seek and maintain employment, commensurate with her treatment needs.    The defendant shall comply with any treatment, evaluations and/or programming as deemed appropriate by a risk and needs assessment and the probation agent.  Defendant must sign any releases agent deems necessary to verify defendant's compliance with probation conditions.  DNA sample.  Credit for 382 days on 15CF135.  Concurrent.  In 16CF124 and 16CF38 State recommended:  a total of 6 years bifurcated as 3 years initial confinement and 3 years extended supervision.  Defense recommended:  jail credit of 422.  Withhold sentence and put her on a lengthly period of probation and in patient treatment.  Strict terms for probation.  Defendant exercised her right to allocution.  

Court ordered:  90 months total,  bifurcated as 42 mo. initial confinement and 48 mo. extended supervision in 15CF135.  Concurrent.  In 16CF124 - Count 1  -90 months total bifurcated as 42 mo initial confinement and 48 mo extended supervision.  Count 2 a total of 6 years bifurcated as 3 years initial confinement and 3 years extended supervision.  16CF38 total of 6 years bifurcated as 3 years initial confinement and 3 years extended supervision.  Eligible for SAP.  Not eligible for CIP.   All concurrent.    Pay restitution to the law firm.  AODA and recommended treatment.  Seek and maintain full time employment in an occupation approved by her agent.    Not to enter into any bars, taverns, liquor stores, liquor department of grocery stores, the bar areas of restaurants. Defendant may not possess or consume any alcohol, nor be anywhere alcohol is available for consumption on the premises where the defendant is located.     Not to possess or consume any controlled substances.   Not to possess any drug paraphernalia.  Not to possess any prescription medications of any kind unless those have been prescribed to the defendant by a physician, and in that case, the defendant shall take such medications only as prescribed.  Defendant shall not alter the form of any prescription prior to, or in conjunction with, ingestion.  Not to associate with any known illegal drug users or dealers. The defendant shall comply with any treatment, evaluations and/or programming as deemed appropriate by a risk and needs assessment and the probation agent.  Defendant must sign any releases agent deems necessary to verify defendant's compliance with probation conditions.  Submit DNA sample.  Concurrent.  Credit for 422 days.  Obey all no contact orders of her agent.  CC.   Pay the costs of supervision.
paper copy of PSI given to the DA's office.
emailed to Judge Goodman's JA.
Judge Goodman granted probation agent Miles' request for a 2-week extension in letter form.  The PSI is due by September 10, 2017.
From Agent Teresa Miles requesting an extension to complete the PSI.  (I faxed it to Judge Goodman)
Plea hearing June 30, 2017

DA Gerald Fox appeared for the State.  Defendant appeared in person, in custody, with Attorney Kisken.  Defendant plead guilty to 15CF135, Count 1.   16CF38, Count 4.  16CF124, Counts 1 and 2.    Remaining counts and tracking cases dismissed, but read in for sentencing purposes.  Victim notification complied with. $504.00 restitution due to Weld Riley Law Firm.   Court recited the charges and possible penalties on the counts she plead to.  Defendant understood.  Felony warnings given. Court reviewed the plea questionnaire, constitutional rights and elements with the defendant. Defense stipulated that there is a factual basis for the pleas.   Court found that the defendant freely, voluntarily, knowingly and intelligently entered her pleas and waived her constitutional rights.  Court found that a factual basis exists for the pleas.  Find guilty of Burglary, contrary to 943.10(1m)(a) and Forgery, contrary to 943.38(11) in 16CF124.  Felony Bail jumping, contrary to 946.49(1)(b) in 16CF38.  Possession with intent Heroin <=3g, contrary to 961.41(1m)(d)(1) in 15CF135.  Court ordered PSI.  Due 8/18/17.  Set for 1 hour sentencing hearing.  Remand to the Jackson County Sheriff's Dept.

State requests the bonds previously ordered forfeited to remain forfeited and requests a new bond of $500 cash with conditions.  Orders bond as requested.
